tasks.task: Construct and operate a low-cost rope pump for water extraction.
subtasks: Gather local materials such as PVC pipe, poly rope, wood, used car tire, glass bottles, wire, wax, nails, and bolts.
Use hand tools like a hand saw, hand drill, knife, and wrenches to build the pump.
Create a hole saw from a bicycle frame for drilling the well.
Prepare wood bearings and coat them with wax for smooth operation.
Install glass bottles at the top and bottom of the pump to reduce rope friction.
Make pistons from the tire sidewall and set up a double piston arrangement for efficiency.
Assemble the pump to connect to a 20-foot hand-dug well.
Operate the pump using arms or legs to lift water up through the PVC pipe.

tasks.task: Set up a distribution system for agricultural use.
subtasks: Construct a three-row water distribution system using wood and painted fabric.
Connect a Visqueen drip irrigation system for reduced water needs.

tasks.task: Maintain the pump and distribution system.
subtasks: Perform regular checks and maintenance on the pump components.
Replace worn parts such as the rope, pistons, or glass bottles as needed.
Inspect the drip irrigation system for leaks or blockages and address issues.

tasks.task: Protect the water source from contamination.
subtasks: Ensure the well is cased with wood to prevent contamination.
Use a protected well casing for domestic water needs to keep the source clean.
